Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; interior reserved with three brown bands; exterior: from top, trace of undetermined motif; two brown bands; black-figure decoration consisting of lion (eye, snout, upper jaw, teeth, and fang remaining) to right; at right, part of rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Bryn Mawr, the Art and Artifact Collections. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2084) (phase 2)
